gsd.inescid.markpledge3
Class CGS97BallotValidity

java.lang.Object
  gsd.inescid.markpledge3.CGS97BallotValidity

public class CGS97BallotValidity
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Rui This class implements the ballot validity proof described in CGS97 (A Secure and Optimally Efficient Multi-Authority Election Scheme) It implements the non interactive version using a hash function to generate a random challenge (Fiat-Shamir heuristic).

CGS97BallotValidity

public CGS97BallotValidity(java.lang.Boolean ballotType,
                           ElGamalVerifiableEncryption ballotEncryption,
                           ElGamalPublicKey kpub,
                           java.math.BigInteger m,
                           java.util.Random random,
                           java.lang.String hashFunction)
                    throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
Create the validity proof data for the received ballot/vote encryption

Parameters:
ballotType - ballot/vote type: true=>YESvote, false=>NOvote
ballotEncryption - ballot/vote encryption
kpub - public key used in the vote encryption
m - value encrypted: m=G^v and v=1 (YESvote) or v=-1 (NOvote)
random - source data
hashFunction - to use in the Fiat-Shamir heuristic
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the hashFunction specified is not supported

verifyBallotValidity

public static boolean verifyBallotValidity(ElGamalEncryption ballot,
                                           CGS97BallotValidity validity,
                                           ElGamalPublicKey kpub,
                                           java.math.BigInteger m,
                                           java.math.BigInteger mInv,
                                           java.security.MessageDigest md)
                                    throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
This method verifies the validity of a ballot/vote accordingly to the CGS97 validation algorithm

Parameters:
ballot - - the ballot/vote to verify
validity - - the validity proof data
kpub - - the public key used in the ballot/vote encryption
m - - message representing a YESvote (G^1 in CGS97)
mInv - - message representing a NOvote (G^-1 in CGS97)
hashFunction - name of the hash function used in the CGS97 c parameter generation process
Returns:
true if the verification process succeeds and false otherwise.
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

fillByteArrayByMultipleHash

public static final byte[] fillByteArrayByMultipleHash(byte[] originalData,
                                                       java.security.MessageDigest md,
                                                       java.math.BigInteger q)
This method return a pseudo-random value in Z_q by making multiple hashes of the originalData

Parameters:
originalData - base input data to the hash function
md - Message digest object to use
q - limit value
Returns:
pseudo-random value in Z_q = r_0 || r_1 || r_2 ... r_0 = originalData r_i = digest(output_(i-1))
Throws:
java.security.InvalidParameterException - when a parameter is null
